info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 2:55PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHERN DEARBORN, HAMILTON, BUTLER, NORTHWESTERN CLERMONT AND SOUTHERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM EDT... At 253 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Bright to Camp Dennison, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Mason, Oxford, Lebanon, Norwood, Forest Park, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Trenton, Springdale, Reading, Montgomery, Harrison, North College Hill and Madeira. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 4 and 39. I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 158 and 171. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 19. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 4 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If these storms become stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
